qas.question: Which already existing schools did Southwestern affiliate itself with in the 1870's and 1880's?
What is the youngest law school in Chicago?
What type of member was Northwestern of the Big Eight Conference?

context: Northwestern fielded its first <a0_0><b5_0>intercollegiate football<b5_0/><a0_0/> team in 1882, later becoming <a4_0>a <b8_0>founding member<b8_0/><a4_0/> of the Big Ten Conference. In the 1870s and 1880s, Northwestern affiliated itself with already existing <a1_0><b6_0>schools of law, medicine, and dentistry in Chicago<b6_0/><a1_0/>. The <a2_0>Northwestern University School of Law<a2_0/> is the oldest law school in Chicago. As the university increased in wealth and distinction, and enrollments grew, these professional schools were integrated with the undergraduate college in Evanston; the result was a modern research university combining professional, graduate, and undergraduate programs, which gave equal weight to teaching and research. <a3_0>The <b7_0>Association of American Universities<b7_0/><a3_0/> invited Northwestern to become a member in 1917.
